level.text: A hearing under this chapter shall be open to the public.
A respondent has the right at a hearing:
To be represented by an attorney in accordance with section 3129;
To be present all relevant evidence by means of witnesses, books, papers, and other means;
To cross-examine each witness on any relevant matter; and
To have subpoenas issued to compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of relevant documents or other evidence, upon written request to the Director.
Source: Final Rulemaking published at 39 DCR 7853, 7870 (October 23, 1992).
